page.title: 03Dalton Trust, Dean
page.content: In 1984 the Dalton Charity was formed with Â£80,000 the estate of Madge, Charlotte and Louis Dalton. The Parish Council are Custodian Trustees to provide benefit to the community of Dean and especially the old and young. Biannually the village elect 2 trustees and the Parish Council appoint 3. These 5 management trustees have organised a children's Christmas party, given pensioners a Christmas hamper and have bought the cricket field of 7.98 acres for approximately Â£20,000 to provide a play are for the village. The Dalton family of Dean House have always been benefactors of the village. Dalton Cottage, the former lacemaking school was their last home.The village raised Â£700 for the old school and the land was given by the Daltons.They matched all fund raising penny for penny.
